translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਚਿਤਵਉ ਚਿਤਵਿ ਸਰਬ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਵਉ ਆਗੈ ਭਾਵਉ ਕਿ ਨ ਭਾਵਉ ॥

translation.text: Contemplating Him within my consciousness, I obtain total peace; but hereafter, will I be pleasing to Him or not?

transliteration.text: chitavau chitav sarab sukh pāvau āgai bhāvau k n bhāvau .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਏਕੁ ਦਾਤਾਰੁ ਸਗਲ ਹੈ ਜਾਚਿਕ ਦੂਸਰ ਕੈ ਪਹਿ ਜਾਵਉ ॥੧॥

translation.text: There is only One Giver; all others are beggars. Who else can we turn to? ||1||

transliteration.text: ēk dātār sagal hai jāchik dūsar kai pah jāvau .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

translation.text: When I beg from others, I am ashamed.

text: ਸਗਲ ਛਤ੍ਰਪਤਿ ਏਕੋ ਠਾਕੁਰੁ ਕਉਨੁ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਲਾਵਉ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: The One Lord Master is the Supreme King of all; who else is equal to Him? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: sagal shatrapat ēkō thākur kaun samasar lāvau .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਊਠਉ ਬੈਸਉ ਰਹਿ ਭਿ ਨ ਸਾਕਉ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਖੋਜਿ ਖੋਜਾਵਉ ॥

translation.text: Standing up and sitting down, I cannot live without Him. I search and search for the Blessed Vision of His Darshan.

transliteration.text: ūthau baisau rah bh n sākau darasan khōj khōjāvau .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਬ੍ਰਹਮਾਦਿਕ ਸਨਕਾਦਿਕ ਸਨਕ ਸਨੰਦਨ ਸਨਾਤਨ ਸਨਤਕੁਮਾਰ ਤਿਨ੍ਹ ਕਉ ਮਹਲੁ ਦੁਲਭਾਵਉ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Even Brahma and the sages Sanak, Sanandan, Sanaatan and Sanat Kumar, find it difficult to obtain the Mansion of the Lord's Presence. ||2||

transliteration.text: brahamādik sanakādik sanak sanandan sanātan sanatakumār tinh kau mahal dulabhāvau .2.

text: ਅਗਮ ਅਗਮ ਆਗਾਧਿ ਬੋਧ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਰੈ ਨ ਪਾਵਉ ॥

translation.text: He is unapproachable and unfathomable; His wisdom is deep and profound; His value cannot be appraised.

transliteration.text: agam agam āgādh bōdh kīmat parai n pāvau .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਤਾਕੀ ਸਰਣਿ ਸਤਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਕੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਧਿਆਵਉ ॥੩॥

translation.text: I have taken to the Sanctuary of the True Lord, the Primal Being, and I meditate on the True Guru. ||3||

transliteration.text: tākī saran sat purakh kī satigur purakh dhiāvau .3.

text: ਭਇਓ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲੁ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਠਾਕੁਰੁ ਕਾਟਿਓ ਬੰਧੁ ਗਰਾਵਉ ॥

translation.text: God, the Lord Master, has become kind and compassionate; He has cut the noose of death away from my neck.

transliteration.text: bhaiō kripāl daiāl prabh thākur kātiō bandh garāvau .

text: ਕਹੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਜਉ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਪਾਇਓ ਤਉ ਫਿਰਿ ਜਨਮਿ ਨ ਆਵਉ ॥੪॥੧॥੧੨੧॥

translation.text: Says Nanak, now that I have obtained the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, I shall not have to be reincarnated again. ||4||1||121||

transliteration.text: kah nānak jau sādhasang pāiō tau phir janam n āvau .4.1.121.
